intro: Faramea pohliana, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Faramea pohliana thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
